scriptRunUntrusted.message:
A script from untrusted source asks to be run for Ninja Cookie to complete the cookie banner setup.

Running untrusted script can be dangerous. Do you want to continue ?

Content: '$CONTENT$'
Origin: $URL$
scriptRunUntrusted.description: The message displayed before running script from untrusted origin

scriptUnauthorized.message: Untrusted script has not been authorized to run.

disabledStatus.message: Ninja Cookie is disabled for this tab.

disabledReportMessage.message:
Dear Ninja Cookie support,

An error occured in a disabled tab.
Here are the technical information you need :
    URL: $URL$
    Version: $VERSION$
    User-Agent: $USERAGENT$

Please have a look at it.
Regards,

externalStatus.message: This tab has been opened by Ninja Cookie to setup the cookie banner of another tab.

externalStatusDesc.message:
Ninja Cookie opened this tab because it needs to setup the cookie banner of the site you were visiting.
This tab will be closed automatically when the setup is complete.

externalReportMessage.message:

Regards,

Ninja Cookie has detected a cookie banner on this web page but doesn't know how to set it up.
It has been hidden by using the alternative rule lists. You can disable this in the settings.

holidayChristmas.message: Happy holiday season and a merry Christmas!

messageWelcome.message:
Hi, I'm Ninja Cookie! I'll be at your side when you browse the web. I'll take care of cookie banners for you by refusing the use of cookies that aren't essential to the proper functioning of websites.

You'll find me in the toolbar of your browser, next to the other extensions. There you'll find options and more information about cookie banners I'll setup. You can also use extra features by becoming Premium for the amount of your choice!

Click me, and I'll disappear!

messageUpdate.message:
Great news : Ninja Cookie is growing up and is now offering you new features by becoming Premium!

You can, for example, disable this sticker or whitelist websites. You can chose the amount of your Ninja Cookie Premium subscription based on what you can and want to give us.

messagePremiumPromotionAfterAWeek.message:
If you want Ninja Cookie to ignore a cookie banner on a specific website, you can do so by becoming a Ninja Cookie Premium user.

By doing so, you will be supporting the development and improvement of the project. And you can chose the amount of your Premium subscription based on what you can and want to give!

messagePremiumPromotionEveryMonth.message:
Did you checked out the Ninja Cookie Premium features? You could, for example, disable this sticker. Check them all out!

You can chose the amount of your Premium subscription based on what you can and want to give!

settingsResetConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to reset your settings? All custom settings will be lost.

settingsWhitelistBadDomain.description: The error message displayed when trying to add an invalid domain name

settingsWhitelistAlreadyExists.message: Domain '$DOMAIN$' is already in the whitelist.
settingsWhitelistAlreadyExists.description: The error message displayed when trying to add domain already in the list

settingsStickerDesc.message: Show/Hide the status sticker displayed every time the Ninja is working on a cookie banner. The toolbar icon will still change based on status and extra information can still be obtained by clicking on the toolbar icon.

settingsStickerPositionDesc.message: Chose where the sticker will be displayed on the page.

settingsLiveDesc.message: Show/Hide what the Ninja is doing when working on a cookie banner.

settingsWhitelistDesc.message: Add/Remove a domain name to the whitelist

settingsWhitelistAddDesc.message: Add here the domain you want to add to the whitelist using the following format: ***.com

settingsNCListsDesc.message: The Ninja uses a list of rules that explains how to handle cookie banners. These lists are downloaded and updated automatically.

settingsNCListsDefaultDesc.message:
By default, the Ninja will use predefined lists of rules.

A new rule is release in 'Beta' list, then 'Release Candidate' list and finally in 'Stable' list. It gives the developers some time to improve and verify that each new rule is working properly before sending it to all the users.

If you want to help improve the new rules or if you want to have the latest rules and you don't mind encountering few bugs, feel free to change your default lists.

settingsNCListsCustomDesc.message:
The Ninja is able to load rules lists from wherever you want.

You can also write your own rules. Check the documentation for more information. Adding community rules lists will be possible soon.

settingsABListsDesc.message: The Ninja doesn't know how to handle all the cookie banners (yet!). During its training, it is possible to use Ad Block lists to hide the cookie banner he doesn't know about.

settingsABListsEnabled.message: Enable alternative lists as complement of Ninja Cookie lists

settingsABListsEnabledDesc.message: Enable/Disable the use of Ad Block lists.

settingsABListsDefaultDesc.message:
By default, the Ninja will use a predefined set of Ad Block lists :

  • Easylist Cookie List
  • I don't care about cookies

These lists have been chosen for their efficiency. You can disable them and chose your own lists.

settingsABListsCustomDesc.message:
The Ninja is able to load Ad Block lists from wherever you want.

Feel free to add lists from the community or your own lists here.

Please be aware that Ninja Cookie can only handle cosmetics rules at the moment : its goal isn't to be yet another ad blocker.

settingsDebugDesc.message: These debug options are for very advanced users. They allow you to monitor Ninja Cookie's actions via the console.

settingsLicenseDesc.message:
Ninja Cookie is free and we want to keep it that way. This is why you can get extra features for a small fee or even for free!

If you like what we're doing, please consider subscribing to a paid license key. Otherwise you can always get a 30-days free license key.

settingsLicenseKeyDesc.message: Add your Premium license key here

settingsSubscriptionSubtitle.message: Subscribe to Ninja Cookie Premium features from $AMOUNT$/month!
settingsSubscriptionSubtitle.description: The message shown under the license info

Expected format is XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXXXX

popupStatsDesc.message:
The Ninja is setting up cookie banners faster than most. In average, it would take $FACTOR$ times longer to do it manually.
The Ninja spent $TIME$ $UNIT$ working on your cookie banners, but you saved more time than that!
popupStatsDesc.description: The message explaining stats and saving factor

popupTweeterContent.message: $ACCOUNT$ has rejected the use of non-essential cookies and removed $COUNT$ cookie pop-ups for me, saving me $TIME$ $UNIT$! Go check #NinjaCookie out here https://ninja-cookie.com/ and install it, it's free!
popupTweeterContent.description: The prefilled content of a Tweet

settingsTrustAllDesc.message: If you are using custom rules lists, they may need to run small scripts to do their job. You will be asked whether you trust their origin before running them. Activating this option will assume that you trust them all. This is dangerous and can lead to security breaches. Use with caution.
